messages: 92daa0f9e13d06e6b032938c0d7cacc8 (01:33): Is it possible to put a div inside a table?
92daa0f9e13d06e6b032938c0d7cacc8 (01:33): I want to hide/show table rows

9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (01:35): jimi_: It is not possible to put a DIV as a child of TABLE. It is possible to put a DIV as a child of TD or TH. However, adding a DIV is irrelevant to the goal of hiding or showing table rows.
92daa0f9e13d06e6b032938c0d7cacc8 (01:35): I was going to do like <div id="test"><tr><td>text</td></tr></div> and then change the display to none or block depending on what i wanted to do
bc223f17b0a86c9a6e5173db17ce049e (01:36): webben: how do you show/hide table rows then? I'm working on that right now and I'm kinda puzzled on the workings of it :P
d904599166468285e953ea8e2f7ce1cc (01:36): webben: Hmm, would you know a better way to force td borders to display than adding &nbsp; inside td if td content is empty?
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (01:36): jimi_: CSS applies to TR, TD, and TD, just as it applies to DIV.
bc223f17b0a86c9a6e5173db17ce049e (01:36): jimi_: did you try <tr><td><div id="test">text</div></td></tr> ?
bc223f17b0a86c9a6e5173db17ce049e (01:36): it sounds more logical to me o_o
92daa0f9e13d06e6b032938c0d7cacc8 (01:37): webben_ said you can't put a div inside a table
bc223f17b0a86c9a6e5173db17ce049e (01:37): oh, sucks
d904599166468285e953ea8e2f7ce1cc (01:37): You're not putting it inside a table there.
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (01:37): orvokki: http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS21/tables.html#propdef-empty-cells and http://www.cs.tut.fi/~jkorpela/HTML/emptycells.html
92daa0f9e13d06e6b032938c0d7cacc8 (01:37): webben, so give the row an id? and do like document.getelementbyid...etc on the row?
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (01:37): jimi_: I said you can't put a DIV as a child of a TABLE (which is more specific).
bc223f17b0a86c9a6e5173db17ce049e (01:38): table isn't the same as td
d904599166468285e953ea8e2f7ce1cc (01:38): webben: Thanks, I thought the solution I had been using was ugly.
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (01:38): jimi_: It's hard to say the best way to select a TR without knowing more about what you're doing.
92daa0f9e13d06e6b032938c0d7cacc8 (01:39): so i should make some sort of getelementbyclass function, and just give the rows a class that i want to show/hide
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (01:40): jimi_: http://www.robertnyman.com/2005/11/07/the-ultimate-getelementsbyclassname/ is just one example.
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (01:41): jimi_: You should probably also be setting a class "hidden" and set .hidden {display: none;} in your CSS.
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (01:41): keep the JS and CSS as decoupled as possible.
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (01:41): also think about what happens when your CSS isn't applied
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (01:41): it may be you need to consider adding and removing rows rather than just hiding and showing them.
bc223f17b0a86c9a6e5173db17ce049e (01:42): webben: how do you add them?
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (01:42): DARKGuy: http://del.icio.us/benjaminhawkeslewis/(X)HTML%3Atable%2BdocumentObjectModel
bc223f17b0a86c9a6e5173db17ce049e (01:43): thanks webben :)

18e8ef9c6f07a53f1c2368ea74c77d12 (01:56): Is it appropriate to put divs and such in an ordered list?
18e8ef9c6f07a53f1c2368ea74c77d12 (01:56): I want to have a list for fruits but I also want to have a description, nutrition info, etc box, for each fruit.

9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (01:58): subsume|work: It's certainly valid to put DIV inside LI. The question is whether a) assuming LI, DIV is the most appropriate markup for the subcomponents b) whether a OL or UL is semantically the most appropriate markup for the end result anyways
18e8ef9c6f07a53f1c2368ea74c77d12 (01:59): webben: ok, but before I get into that, you're saying that my div with extended information about the fruit should go in the li with the fruit name?
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (01:59): as opposed to going where?
18e8ef9c6f07a53f1c2368ea74c77d12 (01:59): <li>Fruit name</li>  <div> ... </div>
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (01:59): ah, yes, that's not valid.
18e8ef9c6f07a53f1c2368ea74c77d12 (01:59): Does the use of lists have any advantage when attempting to print?
18e8ef9c6f07a53f1c2368ea74c77d12 (02:00): (do browsers do better at page breaking, etc?)
18e8ef9c6f07a53f1c2368ea74c77d12 (02:00): I was having lots of trouble with cut-offs using standard floating divs
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (02:01): subsume|work: Not that I'm aware off. Sounds like your problems have to do with CSS styling not markup choice.
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (02:01): and best solved with print stylesheets
18e8ef9c6f07a53f1c2368ea74c77d12 (02:01): I use print stylesheets but could never get them to entirely respect rows made of divs
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (02:01): http://www.alistapart.com/articles/goingtoprint/ and http://css-discuss.incutio.com/?page=PrintStylesheets
18e8ef9c6f07a53f1c2368ea74c77d12 (02:01): I hear the problem was the use of float.

25d97014987e7c60610357dfa844bd61 (02:37): subsume|work: FIELDSET is for group form controls, not blocks of information.
